title: bitnote
author: bitnote
content: I'm new here. I've only been reading threads and FAQs for a few days and now I'm starting to post with a basic crypto knowledge.I found out about crypto by watching youtube. There are many youtubers who have very low knowledge about crypto and only post shitcoins in 50% of their youtube videos.I watched a youtube video where a youtuber talked about bitcoin and satoshi and forum. So I did a google searched about bitcoin forum and ended up here.

comments.author: Parvati_j
comments.body: You are welcome bitnote, I can see that you are also a newbie like me and your posting ratio shows that you might become an active poster in this local board and the bitcoin talk forum at large, with the little I have seen here in this forum, I assure you that this is the right place to learn and acquire more knowledge about Bitcoin and crypto at large, as you will find interesting topics and discussions here.I am glad to hear that you have read some FAQs and thread, I'll urge you to also keep the forum rules so as to avoid negative trust.Here is a thread I created asking for advise and I got some, it might also interest you if you check it out.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5469338.0

comments.author: pawanjain
comments.body: Welcome to the forum and the Indian board. One thing that I would advice both of you is NEVER EVER copy a post or a sentence from any place and post it as your own content.Your account will be tagged for plagiarism and you will lose all the reputation you have gained.If you want to use some sentences from any other place then post it with proper credits and link of source.Keep reading, keep learning and contributing to this forum and majorly on the Indian board.

comments.author: pakhitheboss
comments.body: Hello! Welcome to the forum and Indian local board. We are a handful of Indians that are active here. If you think you have topics that might interest fellow Indians then do share it. Please do read the rules threads pinned on every board in the forum before creating a topic or posting a reply. It will help you to grow up in rank with the forum. Below are a few important threads that you should go through. Bitcoin Resources - Consolidate List (India Specific)Merit & new rank requirementsUnofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQA short introduction to the Trust SystemBeginners & Help Encyclopedia

comments.author: bitnote
comments.body: Quote from: pakhitheboss on October 13, 2023, 02:26:22 AMHello! Welcome to the forum and Indian local board. We are a handful of Indians that are active here. If you think you have topics that might interest fellow Indians then do share it. Please do read the rules threads pinned on every board in the forum before creating a topic or posting a reply. It will help you to grow up in rank with the forum. Below are a few important threads that you should go through. Bitcoin Resources - Consolidate List (India Specific)Merit & new rank requirementsUnofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQA short introduction to the Trust SystemBeginners & Help Encyclopedia Thank you, @pakhitheboss, for sharing these resources. Having access to guides and a comprehensive list of rules in one place is incredibly helpful. The last link you provided seems like a true encyclopedia!
